security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation skill containing no executable code. It provides guidance for running legitimate security scanning commands (npm audit, SBOM generation) and follows best practices for supply chain security.

content.user_title: Scan dependencies for vulnerabilities and generate SBOM
content.value_statement: Dependency vulnerabilities are a leading cause of security breaches. This skill provides clear guidance for scanning npm packages, generating Software Bill of Materials (SBOM), and implementing supply chain security practices that protect your applications.
actual_capabilities: Run npm audit to detect critical and high severity vulnerabilities
Generate SBOM documents using CycloneDX format
Configure npmrc security settings to prevent malicious script execution
Integrate security checks into CI/CD pipelines
Check for deprecated packages and outdated dependencies
Verify package integrity using lockfiles and npm ci
limitations: Does not automatically fix vulnerabilities - requires manual intervention
Limited to Node.js/npm ecosystem commands and patterns
Does not scan non-JavaScript dependencies or system packages
Security scanner results depend on npm registry vulnerability database

use_cases.title: Security audit automation
use_cases.description: Integrate dependency scanning into CI/CD pipelines to catch vulnerabilities before deployment

use_cases.title: Dependency review process
use_cases.description: Verify new packages are safe before adding them to your project

use_cases.title: Supply chain compliance
use_cases.description: Generate and maintain SBOM documents for regulatory compliance

prompt_templates.title: Quick security scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run npm audit on the current project and report any critical or high severity vulnerabilities

prompt_templates.title: Generate SBOM
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a CycloneDX SBOM for this project and save it to sbom.json

prompt_templates.title: Update dependencies safely
prompt_templates.prompt: Check for outdated packages and create a safe update plan that prioritizes security patches

prompt_templates.title: CI security gate
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a GitHub Actions workflow that runs npm audit and fails if any high or critical vulnerabilities are found

output_examples.input: Run npm audit and check for vulnerabilities
output: Recommendation: Run npm audit fix for automatic patches, then test thoroughly

best_practices: Always commit package-lock.json to ensure reproducible and verifiable builds
Set ignore-scripts=true in .npmrc to prevent pre/post install script attacks
Generate SBOM documents regularly and store them as part of your release artifacts
anti_patterns: Using npm install instead of npm ci in CI pipelines (may install different versions)
Ignoring moderate vulnerabilities without tracking them for later resolution
Adding packages without checking their maintenance status and download counts

faq.question: Does this skill work with yarn or pnpm?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on npm commands. For yarn, use yarn audit; for pnpm, use pnpm audit.

faq.question: What severity level should I block builds on?
faq.answer: Block on critical and high severity. Moderate issues should be tracked; low can be deferred.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: Yes. Add a step that runs npm audit --audit-level=high and exit with failure if vulnerabilities are found.

faq.question: Does this skill send data to external services?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance only. Commands like npm audit make read-only calls to the npm registry.

faq.question: What if npm audit returns no results?
faq.answer: This can mean no vulnerabilities or an outdated npm version. Ensure npm is up to date and try npm audit again.

faq.question: How is this different from Snyk or other scanners?
faq.answer: npm audit uses the npm registry database. Snyk and others have additional databases and features but require configuration.
